column6: Reclaimed products and thei packaging materials
column13: More than half of Endeavour's Dan Murphy's stores nationally, a total of 134, now feature Electronic Shelf Labelling (ESL), reducing paper ticketing and waste and delivering productivity and cost savings to stores. ESL provides a better customer experience with timely and improved pricing accuracy and LED 'light up' functionality, helping customers find products using the 'Ask Uncle Dan' app.
column20: Electronic Shelf Labelling, paper ticketing, waste

column6: Reclaimed products and thei packaging materials
column13: In F23, Endeavour created the Sustainable Packaging Guidelines so that everyone who works to bring its products to life Ã¢ÂÂ from Endeavour's marketers, procurement team, and its contracted supply partners Ã¢ÂÂ has a shared understanding of Endeavour's commitments to improve its packaging. That way, Endeavour can design for sustainability and enhance the circularity of its products.
column20: Sustainable Packaging Guidelines, supply partner, packaging

column6: Reclaimed products and thei packaging materials
column13: In F23, Endeavour has identified cork as a key material type it needs to solve to deliver on its packaging and waste commitments. Endeavour established the trial Recork program to assess the feasibility and impact of a store-based cork recycling program. Through the Recork program, customers can return their corks to selected BWS and Dan Murphy's stores in F24. Australian shoe recyclers Save Our Soles will lead in repurposing Endeavour's recycled cork into anti-fatigue mats for its team.

column6: Reclaimed products and thei packaging materials
column13: Endeavour teamed up with leading Australian packaging solutions company Orora to provide a more sustainable option for the Reverse Taper wine bottle. The new lightweight Reverse Taper BVS bottle is 420 grams, 195 grams lighter than other options, and has a recycled glass content of about 40%. Reverse Taper bottles, which are wider at the shoulders than the base, are a popular premium option in the wine industry due to their unique appearance and shelf appeal.
column20: Reverse Taper BVS bottle, Orora, recycled glass content

column6: Energy consumption outside of the organization

column13: Additional energy efficiency improvements are underway in refrigeration in Endeavour's Retail stores in NSW and VIC. This program involves the replacement of 144 open cases with cases with doors to reduce refrigeration energy consumption. Where possible, Endeavour also retrofits doors on existing cases to increase the assets and lifecycle and further reduce consumption.
column20: Energy efficiency improvement, energy consumption, refrigeration

column13: Endeavour completed an LED lighting roll-out in all its retail stores and started to install occupancy sensors in the back-of-house areas of Dan Murphy's sites, where they still need to be included. The occupancy sensors are set in motion, turning off the lights during the day and when the areas are unoccupied.
column20: Occupancy sensor, LED lighting, retail store

column13: More than 99 Endeavour's retail sites feature smart control systems, which use a combination of sensors and intelligent algorithms to provide seamless control and monitoring capabilities. They offer a convenient way to regulate and customise settings remotely through online portals, including lighting, temperature, and security systems, optimising energy efficiency, enhancing convenience and creating a more intelligent and tailored store environment.
column20: Smart control system, monitoring capability, online portal

column6: Reductions in energy requirements of products and services
Interactions with water as a shared resource
column7: Endeavour has been working to understand better climatic conditions to drive water efficiency and security for its sites. Endeavour implemented a system to better capture and consolidate water usage data across all sites, enabling it to identify opportunities for better efficiency.

column13: In F23, Endeavour's wastewater treatment plant between its Dorrien Estate (Tanunda) and Vinpac International (Angaston) sites in the Barossa region captured, treated and reused 66,441 kilolitres of water used in operations. The treated water irrigates 22 hectares of Endeavour's crops and gardens.

column6: Operational sites owned, leased, managed in, or adjacent to, protected areas and areas of high biodiversity value outside protected areas
Significant impacts of activities, produces, and services on biodiversity
Significant impacts of activities, produces, and services on biodiversity
column13: Eight Endeavour sites are certified through the Sustainable Winegrowing Australia (SWA) program, and four sites are certified to ISO 14001:2015. SWA is a national program for grape growers and winemakers to demonstrate and continuously improve sustainability in the vineyard and winery through their businesses' environmental, social, and economic aspects. Endeavour has been involved in the program since it started, with reporting allowing it to benchmark its operations against other vineyards and wineries and help identify areas for improvement.

column6: Significant impacts of activities, produces, and services on biodiversity
column13: Endeavour established its best-practice Biodiversity Action Plan to track and improve local biodiversity at Chapel Hill. The plan has been shared with Endeavour's vineyards and wineries and adopted by Dorrien Estate Winery as part of its SWA certification. Through collaboration between Endeavour's viticulturists and sustainability leads, sustainable land management practice models are being rolled out to conserve, enhance and create biodiversity areas in Endeavour's vineyards and surrounding environments.
column20: Biodiversity Action Plan, Chapel Hill, vineyard

column6: Significant impacts of activities, produces, and services on biodiversity
column13: In F23, Endeavour's Dorrien Estate Winery conducted a flora and fauna audit to establish a revegetation plan with a biodiversity focus. The plan considered the existing flora on-site in the winery expansion concept plans. It detailed a revegetation program that would be conducive to the quality requirements of an operating site while specifically targeting local flora species that would support endangered fauna species endemic to the Barossa region.
column20: Flora and fauna audit, biodiversity, revegetation plan

column6: IUCN Red List species and national conversation list species with habitats in areas affected by operations

column7: Endeavour's scope 1 emissions in 2023 were 33,168 tCO2e.
Endeavour's scope 2 emissions in 2023 were 295,044 tCO2e.
Endeavour's scope 3 emissions in 2023 were 27,808 tCO2e.
